verses.verse: Abraham<WH85> traveled<WH5265> from there toward the land<WH776> of the South,<WH5045> and lived<WH3427> between Kadesh<WH6946> and Shur.<WH7793> He lived as a foreigner<WH1481> in Gerar.<WH1642>
Abraham<WH85> said<WH559> about<WH413> Sarah<WH8283> his wife,<WH802> "She is my sister.<WH269>" Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4428> of Gerar<WH1642> sent,<WH7971> and took<WH3947> Sarah.<WH8283>

But God<WH430> came<WH935> to Abimelech<WH40> in a dream<WH2472> of the night,<WH3915> and said<WH559> to him,<WH4191> "Behold, you are a dead man, because of the woman<WH802> whom you have taken.<WH3947> For she is a man<WH1167>'s wife.<WH1166>"
Now Abimelech<WH40> had not come near<WH7126> her.<WH559> He said, "Lord,<WH136> will you kill<WH2026> even a righteous<WH6662> nation?<WH1471>

Didn't<WH559> he tell me,<WH1931> 'She is my sister?<WH269>' She,<WH1931> even<WH1571> she<WH1931> herself,<WH559> said, <WH251> 'He is my brother.' In the integrity<WH8537> of my heart<WH3824> and the innocence<WH5356> of my hands<WH3709> have I done this.<WH6213>"

God<WH430> said<WH559> to him in the dream,<WH2472> "Yes,<WH1571> I know<WH3045> that in the integrity<WH8537> of your heart<WH3824> you have done<WH6213> this,<WH2820> and I also withheld you from sinning<WH2398> against me.<WH5414> Therefore I didn't allow you to touch her.<WH5060>

Now therefore,<WH7725> restore the man<WH376>'s wife.<WH802> For he is a prophet,<WH5030> and he will pray<WH6419> for you,<WH1157> and you will live.<WH2421> If you don't<WH7725> restore her,<WH3045> know for sure<WH4191> that you will die,<WH4191> you, and all who are yours."

Abimelech<WH40> rose early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> and called<WH7121> all his servants,<WH5650> and told<WH1696> all these things<WH1697> in their ear.<WH241> The men<WH582> were very<WH3966> scared.<WH3372>

Then Abimelech<WH40> called<WH7121> Abraham,<WH85> and said<WH559> to him,<WH6213> "What have you done to us?<WH2398> How have I sinned against you,<WH935> that you have brought on me and on my kingdom<WH4467> a great<WH1419> sin?<WH2401> You have done<WH6213> deeds<WH4639> to me that ought not to be done!<WH6213>"
Abimelech<WH40> said<WH559> to Abraham,<WH85> "What<WH4100> did you<WH7200> see,<WH6213> that you have done this thing?<WH1697>"
Abraham<WH85> said,<WH559> "Because I thought,<WH559> <WH7535> 'Surely the fear<WH3374> of God<WH430> is not in this place.<WH4725> They will kill me<WH2026> for my wife<WH802>'s sake.<WH1697>'
Besides,<WH546> she is indeed my sister,<WH269> the daughter<WH1323> of my father,<WH1> but not the daughter<WH1323> of my mother;<WH517> and she became my wife.<WH802>

It happened,<WH430> when God caused me to wander<WH8582> from my father<WH1>'s house,<WH1004> that I said<WH559> to her,<WH2617> 'This is your kindness which you shall show<WH6213> to me.<WH4725> Everywhere that we go,<WH935> say<WH559> of me,<WH251> "He is my brother."'"

Abimelech<WH40> took<WH3947> sheep<WH6629> and cattle,<WH1241> male servants<WH5650> and female servants,<WH8198> and gave<WH5414> them to Abraham,<WH85> and restored<WH7725> Sarah,<WH8283> his wife,<WH802> to him.
Abimelech<WH40> said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH776> my land is before you.<WH6440> Dwell<WH3427> where it pleases you.<WH2896>"

To Sarah<WH8283> he said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH5414> I have given your brother<WH251> a thousand<WH505> pieces of silver.<WH3701> Behold,<WH3682> it is for you a covering of the eyes<WH5869> to all that are with you.<WH3198> In front of all you are vindicated."
Abraham<WH85> prayed<WH6419> to God.<WH430> God<WH430> healed<WH7495> Abimelech,<WH40> and his wife,<WH802> and his female servants,<WH519> and they bore children.<WH3205>
For Yahweh<WH3068> had closed<WH6113> up<WH6113> tight all the wombs<WH7358> of the house<WH1004> of Abimelech,<WH40> because<WH1697> of Sarah,<WH8283> Abraham<WH85>'s wife.<WH802>
